isis.stitle: Spanish - Guía para Localización de Fallas del Sistema Eléctrico - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - ANTILOCK AIR BRAKE SYSTEM WITH TRACTION CONTROL: BENDIX - 9200, 9300 and 9400 - OPERATION - CONTROLLER/RELAY VALVE (FIGURE 4)

svcprocinfo.para: The controller/relay valve assembly is a controller mounted on a traction modulator and/or antilock relay valve.

svcsubproc.title: Controller
svcsubproc.para:
The controller houses the electronic control unit that regulates the functions of the traction control and/or antilock brake system. The controller performs a system start-up self diagnostic test whenever the vehicle is started and then continues to monitor the antilock system performance during operation of the vehicle. The controller uses the instrument panel ABS warning light and Traction Active light to communicate system performance to the driver. The controller has diagnostic LEDs to provide system diagnostic information. Refer to TROUBLESHOOTING
.

The controller mounts on the antilock relay valve. The controller is electrically connected through connectors (355) and (350) to the wheel sensors, brake modulators, and the cab antilock wire harness. With traction control an additional 2-way connector (360) connects the rear chassis harness to the traction control solenoid (part of the controller/relay valve assembly). The relay valve functions as a service brake relay valve and contains no electronics of its own.

svcsubproc.title: Controller Power Supply
svcsubproc.para: The controller receives battery power from the B1 battery stud through the ABS ignition relay (152).

Ignition relay (152) has battery power applied to common terminal 30, from the B1 battery stud at all times. This circuit is protected by 30A fuse F10-A. The relay is energized by ignition voltage (key ON) from ignition adapter (494) on circuit 13W to the relay control coil at terminal 86. The coil is grounded at terminal 85, through circuits 94-GA/94-G at (455) ground adapter.
With the relay energized, battery power from relay terminal 87 is applied through the cab and chassis harness to controller connector (355) terminals B1, K2 and K3.

svcsubproc.title: Controller Ground Circuits
svcsubproc.para: Controller connector (355) terminals A1, A2 and A3 are grounded to the frame rail.

svcsubproc.title: Engine Brake Interface Wiring - Electronic Engines
svcsubproc.para: With Electronic Engines, the ABS controller is connected to the engine ECM at J1922 data link connector (403). The ABS J1922 data link is a twisted pair of wires (Red positive and light Blue wire negative), from connector (355) terminals B2 and B3. (Refer to CTS-5000 Master Service Manual, Group 08, Electronic Engine Controls.) When the ABS system sends an engine brake disable signal to the engine ECM, the engine ECM disables the engine brake. When the disabling signal is no longer present, the engine brake operation will resume.

svcsubproc.title: Engine Brake Interface Wiring - Caterpillar 3406C (Mechanical Engine)
svcsubproc.para: With the Caterpillar 3406C mechanical engine, Engine Brake Relay (166) is used to disable the engine brake. Ignition voltage (key ON) from ignition adapter (494) on circuit 13W/94B/94C is applied to the engine brake relay control coil (terminal 85) and to the common terminal 30. The engine brake relay normally closed terminal (87A) is connected by circuit 13AF to the engine brake system fuse.
When the ABS engine brake relay (166) is not energized, ignition power passes through the ABS engine brake relay (166), providing power for engine brake operation on circuit 13AF.

Engine Brake Relay (166) has ignition voltage applied at all times to control coil terminal 85. The ground side of the control coil (terminal 86) is connected through circuit 94J to controller connector (355) terminal K1.
The controller disables the engine brake by grounding terminal K1 at connector (355), causing the relay to energize, opening the engine brake feed circuit.

svcsubproc.title: J1708/J1587 Data Link
svcsubproc.para: With electronic and mechanical engines, six-pin data link connector (137) provides access for the Prolink Electronic Service tool to the ABS controller. Bendix and International have Prolink cartridges available for this application.
Controller connector (355) terminals G2 and G3 are connected to the vehicle data link connector by a twisted pair of wires.

svcsubproc.title: Antilock/Bob Tail Proportioning Relay Valve
svcsubproc.para: The antilock relay valve is a specialized service brake relay valve. The valve functions as a brake relay valve and provides Bob Tail proportioning as well, if the vehicle is so configured. If traction control is included, the antilock relay valve contains an electric solenoid for the feature. Vehicles can be configured four ways:

item.para: 04AZC - ABS with bobtail proportioning with tractors (4092)
04AZD - ABS with bobtail proportioning and traction control with tractors (4092)
04AZA - With Tractor (4092) if bobtail proportioning is omitted (code 04WBN)

svcsubproc.para: With each of the above installations a different combination of controller/relay valve is used. The porting on the relay valve portion is the same.

The relay valve has a special cover that permits the direct attachment to the controller. When the controller and relay valve are assembled together, the assembly is called a controller/relay valve assembly.

In the antilock brake system, the controller/relay valve serves as a relay station to speed the application and release of the rear service brakes. Incorporated within the relay valve is a quick release valve next to the service port, which provides for rapid exhausting of control air pressure from above the relay piston. All air connections on the relay valve are identified with cast, embossed letters for ease of maintenance. The letter identification of the air ports on the relay valve are listed in Table 1, Function/Designation Table.
